meanings.definition: To reject or prohibit a decision or proposal
meanings.sent1: The president was vetoing the new law.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up vetoing our ideas.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be vetoing the idea of wearing a costume.
meanings.sent4: His strict diet was like vetoing any indulgence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen was vetoing mistakes left and right.

meanings.definition: The act of exercising the power to prevent something from becoming law or taking effect
meanings.sent1: The vetoing of the bill caused a stir in the government.
meanings.sent2: His constant vetoing of bills led to frustration among lawmakers.
meanings.sent3: The dog's vetoing of the new dog food brand was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The vetoing of the concert due to bad weather disappointed many fans.
meanings.sent5: The mayor's vetoing of the construction project saved the park from destruction.
